description: From Latin dētēctiō, from dētegere (“to detect”), from dē- (“un-”) + tegere (“to cover, to hide”). Equivalent to detect +‎ -ion.

entries.meaning: The act or process of detecting, uncovering, or finding out, the discovery of something new, hidden, or disguised.
(obsolete) Synonym of accusation, the exposure of concealed information about a crime or heresy.
(electrical engineering) The act or process of finding or detecting an electrical signal in a carrier wave.
